metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0655 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL 5.6.29 and earlier and 5.7.11 and earlier and MariaDB 10.0.x before 10.0.25 and 10.1.x before 10.1.14 allows local users to affect availability via vectors related to InnoDB.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0655` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-client - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-server - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.13-0ubuntu4').
